intro: Randia lasiantha, commonly known as the silverleaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in cymes, and its fruit is a small, dry capsule containing several seeds. Randia lasiantha is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
